self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations
Class AnnotatedLayoutInflater

java.lang.Object
  self.philbrown.AbLE.annotations.AnnotatedLayoutInflater

public class AnnotatedLayoutInflater
extends java.lang.Object

Layout Inflater to be used with the Annotated Layout Framework.

Author:
Phil Brown

Field Detail

context

public static AbLEActivity context
This context is passed to the inflater, and in turn is passed to all children inflaters. It is publicly available during layout, after which it is set to null. This allows layout classes access to the activity during inflation, which can be used in a static block.

Method Detail

inflate

public static View inflate(AbLEActivity _context,
                           java.lang.Class<?> layout,
                           ClassAnnotationInflater parent)
This method is called to inflate a View from an annotated class in a layout file. It maintains a record of parent classes so children classes can access variables and other information from super classes in the layout. This method simply delegates the layout inflation to the class with the name of the annotation, followed by "Inflater". The inflater methods generally re-call this method to inflate children views, creating a recursive layout process.

Parameters:
_context - used to create views or access resources
layout - the class that is declared in the layout file
parent - the previous Inflater that created a view. Use null to denote the root of the hierarchy (generally the Activity), or a break in the hierarchy.
Returns:

capitalize

public static java.lang.String capitalize(java.lang.String string)
Capitalizes the first letter of the given string.

Parameters:
string - the string whose first letter should be capitalized
Returns:
the given string with its first letter capitalized
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the string is null or empty
